appendix.title: Setting up a Netboot Environment for Microsoft* Windows
appendix.para: Setting up &compnode;s running Microsoft &hyper; Server or Windows Server 2012 requires to configure the &admserv; to be able to provide the netboot environment for node installation. The environment is generated from a machine running Microsoft &hyper; Server or Microsoft Windows Server 2012.

sect1.title: Requirements
sect1.para: The following requirements must be met in order to successfully deploy &hyper;:

listitem.para: Provide a separate machine running Microsoft Windows Server 2012 or Microsoft &hyper; Server. The machine must be able to access the &admserv; and the Internet.
Install Samba (package samba and the Microsoft &hyper; tools (package hyper-v) on the &admserv;.
and the Microsoft &hyper; tools on the &admserv;.

sect1.title: Providing a &hyper; Netboot Environment
sect1.para: In order to provide a &hyper; netboot environment on the &admserv;, a samba share, that can be mounted on the Windows machine, is created on the &admserv;. Among others, this share contains the &hyper; tools which provide Windows scripts to generate the environment.

Make sure the Samba daemons smb and nmb are automatically started during boot and are currently running by executing the following commands:
step.screen: insserv smb nmb rcsmb start rcnmb start

step.para: Edit the Samba configuration file /etc/samba/smb.conf and add the following share:
step.screen: [reminst] comment = MS Windows remote install guest ok = Yes inherit acls = Yes path = /srv/tftpboot read only = No force user = root
step.para: By default, the workgroup name is set to WORKGROUP in the [global] section of /etc/samba/smb.conf. Adjust it, if needed.

sect1.para: Once Samba is properly configured on the &admserv;, log in to the machine running Microsoft Windows Server 2012 or Microsoft &hyper; Server and generate the environment:

step.para: Log in to the Microsoft Windows Server 2012 or Microsoft &hyper; Server machine. Connect the device name X: to the Samba share \\crowbar\reminst configured on the &admserv; (which is named crowbar by default) in the previous step. This can either be done from the Explorer or on the command line with the net use x: \\crowbar\reminst command.

sect1.para: Once the netboot environment is set up, you can choose either Windows Server 2012 or Hyper-V Server 2012 as the Target Platform for newly discovered nodes from the Node Dashboard.
